newsitem.title: UK: BPB at 10-month low as Hoare cuts estimates.
newsitem.headline: BPB at 10-month low as Hoare cuts estimates.

text.p: Shares in BPB Plc dropped to a 10-month low on Monday after analysts at ABN AMRO Hoare Govett, joint broker to the building materials company, cut earnings estimates following a meeting with BPB on Friday, sources said.
The stock was down 18p at 303-1/2 in moderate volume of 713,908 shares, after earlier dropping as low as 300p -- its lowest since June last year.
At Hoare Govett analysts repeated a "hold" rating on the stock and lowered their pre-tax profit estimate for the year ending September 1997 to 162 million stg from 175 million, market sources said.
For the year after, they cut to 175 million stg from 195 million.
The reduction in part reflected a slow recovery in European demand for paper and plasterboard products, dealers said. Analysts at Hoare Govett were not immediately available for comment.
